bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 154 (Tuesday, September 24, 2019)][House][Pages H7902-H7903]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. LEWIS:H.R. 4471.[[Page H7903]]Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:This bill is enacted pursuant to the power granted toCongress under Article I of the United States Constitutionand its subsequent amendments, and further clarified andinterpreted by the Supreme Court of the United States.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Worker and Family Support.
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text:
Back to Basics Job Creation Act of 2019

This bill requires the Department of Health and Human Services to make grants to states, tribes, or local governments to assist low-income individuals and individuals who have been unemployed for at least three months in developing self-employment opportunities.

bill.title: Back to Basics Job Creation Act of 2019

item.title: Back to Basics Job Creation Act of 2019
To amend title XX of the Social Security Act to provide grants to support job creation initiatives, and for other purposes.
Back to Basics Job Creation Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Worker and Family Support.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
